documents.title: OTP and Multiple Product Families Support
documents.content:
﻿Start Date: Oct 28, 2025

Slack channel: #temp-pex-tam-otp-multi-product-families

Points of Contact:

* Pricing Team: Vitor Buccianti

* New Ventures: Daniel Arias

Ways of Working

* The TAM engineers will be integrated into the Pricing team during the support period.

* The pricing team will ensure clear implementation plans are in place beforehand, allowing engineers to start working on the implementation immediately after the initial onboarding phase on the relevant topics.

________________

The following project consists of 2 separate workstreams related to adding Price Set support for New Ventures brands:

VMS (Factor Form): Channel exclusion with OTP support

* Brand: Factor Form US (VMS)

* Estimation

   * Web: 2-3 weeks

   * Backend: 4 weeks

   * Launch date - Dec 5, 2025

* Support:

   * 1 web engineer (VMS squad) - Edwin Torres

   * 1 backend engineer Morteza Pourkazemi

* Docs:

   * OTP-support ADR

   * Channel exclusion ADR

* Implementation Plan: Rollout new prices for formers (we can convert this into Jira tickets)

* Work 

   * Epic: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/PCNG-1761

   * Frontend

      * Send additional data to the pricing API

      * Needs to be separate API calls for OTP vs. subscriptions since API does not support both at the same time

   * Backend

      * Create the Request Context Manager

      * New price set data schema to support OTP

      * NEW: Support for OTP + Plans call in parallel

         * FE will do a POC to do parallel calls if BE capacity is limited. But only if we deem we cannot find BE capacity





The Pets Table: Multiple Product families support[a]

* Brand: The Pets Table US

* Estimation:

   * Web: n/a

   * Backend: 2-3 weeks (tbd)

   * Launch date - Dec 5, 2025

   * Run AA test first to validate setup - Dec 5, 2025

* Support:

   * 1 web engineer (TPT squad) - Oliver Strobel

   * 1 backend engineer - TBD - looks like 1 BE engineer can complete work for both initiatives

* Docs:

   * Discovery: Discovery: How to onboard markets with multiple product families into price sets

* Work

   * Frontend

      * Onboard TPT on PeX (most of the FE work)

   * Backend

      * TBD after the discovery. Discovery Done on Nov 14, 2025Discovery: How to onboard markets with multiple product families into price sets

      * TBD Medium effort, 3 - 4 

      * Update TPT CRM side to support multiple product families on NV-CRM service. Morteza Pourkazemi to reach out to Vitor Buccianti and pricing team





[a]@vbb@hellofresh.com Just a heads up that we need to handle TrialBox pricing for TPT (the CRM communication) to be able to run any kind of price testing

_Assigned to vbb@hellofresh.com_

04. JANUAR 2026 - IMPRO À LA CARTE ARTEM YASYNSKYY

















































































































































WWW.CLÄRCHENSBALL.HAUS























BERLIN 2026















































































 

Am Sonntag, den 04. Januar 2026, erwartet Euch im Clärchens ein außergewöhnliches Hörerlebnis: Mit einem besonderen Konzertformat eröffnet der international gefeierte Pianist Artem Yasynskyy das neue 

Jahr. 

 

Publikum und Künstler treten in einen lebendigen Dialog: Über Instagram wählen Zuhörer:innen zwei Werke des Abends, im Konzert selbst können sie Themen, Melodien oder eigene Motive einbringen, die 

Yasynskyy spontan in seine Improvisationen aufnimmt.

 

Neben diesen interaktiven Momenten erklingen die gewählten Stücke, eigene Kompositionen sowie fantasievolle Bearbeitungen von Chopin-Etüden – ein Abend voller kreativer Freiheit und gemeinsamer 

Gestaltung.









 



































 









Wann? Sonntag, 04. Januar 2026

Wo? Clärchens Ballhaus - Spiegelsaal

Einlass: 17:30 Uhr Beginn: 18:00 Uhr

* bitte beachtet, dass der Spiegelsaal aufgrund seines Alters leider nicht barrierefrei ist.

### EMAIL: We asked AI how much to spend on gifts
ID: 19b46d326ca4df0b
From: Mindstream <hello@mindstream.news>
----------------------------------------

----------

The tallest Christmas tree ever wasn’t outdoors: it was in a mall.



Back in 1950, a shopping centre in Washington rolled out a 221-foot tree so massive it basically touched the sky.



Peak holiday spirit? No. Peak American retail energy.



**What’s in store:**



* We got AI to tell us how to **gift** **properly** this year!



* **AI Predictions 2026: **Ben Berkley gives his view!



_Read Time: 5 minutes_





--------------------

###### **XMAS WITH AI**



## How Much Should You Spend on Gifts This Year? Let ChatGPT Figure It Out For You



View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/8e533168-d28f-446d-9621-4270e782877f/Matt_Village_Create_a_digital_illustration_in_a_clean_modern__d139ee6d-191b-4de2-bd43-b2e1dc86f1e0_1.png?t=1765977556)

Follow image link: (https://www.mindstream.news/)

Caption: 



Here’s a fun truth about the holiday season.



Most of us have no idea what a “reasonable” holiday budget actually is.



We think we’re being responsible, until January shows up like,_ “Hey bestie, remember that credit card bill?”_



Even if you’re not a big holiday spender, you might be interested in taking advantage of all the sales going on. But, before you go a little click-crazy, you can use ChatGPT to help you feel better about that spending (and, hopefully not worse). 



So this year, instead of guessing, stressing, or doom-scrolling gift guides, I tried something dif



in 2026 — Microsoft has too big of a user base advantage to not win. And Apple? Souped-up Siri has gotta be a showstopper when she finally arrives. Slow and steady can still win a race, especially when slow and steady has a $4 trillion market cap behind it. _



_To date, upstarts like OpenAI and Anthropic have played outsized roles in AI news. They’ll still be plenty relevant in the year ahead. But expecting them to continue performing on par with the richest companies in the history of the world as they spend cash like they’ve never spent before? Seems unlikely._

### EMAIL: Re: Non of the recipes are shown as customizable in the Android app
ID: 19b4666722ae29dd
From: Arie Ridwansyah <arie.ridwansyah@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

*Hello everyone,*





*The incident is resolved.*



These are the details on what happened.



   - *Android* and *iOS* cannot customize any recipes. This option was not

   even being shown on client apps.

   - The feature was working as expected on Web. Web was showing

   customization on the product details page. Also, despite the customization

   nudge not being shown on the recipe list, this has been confirmed to be
